page.title: 08Manor Farm:Pigs
page.content:
110 Landrace sows are crossed with Hampshire boars to produce breeding gilts for sale at 90 kg. and pork pigs at 65kg.
The majority of the{feed,}35 tonnes per month, is prepared on the site using wheat and barley grown on the farm mixed with purchased soya, fish meal and mineral and vitamin supplements.
{Sows farrow}on average 2.4 litters a year with 11 piglets to a litter. They are weaned at 3 weeks weighing 5 kg. In a further 100 days the pork pigs are sold direct to an abattoir. Breeding gilts are kept until they reach the heavier weight and are delivered as required to each customer's farm.
